website_summaries.verdict: A classic Swiss Army knife with seven functions. Useful in a wide range of situations.
pros: Seven implements: blade, scissors, nail file, screwdriver, key ring, tweezers, toothpick
Available in an extensive range of handle colors and patterns
cons: Blade is only a little over one inch long

customer_reviews.title: Keyring on wrong end
customer_reviews.text: It's not shiny like I was hoping – the glow in the dark green. I'm disappointed because I put it on my keychain and the ring on the knife is right next to the blade and completely gets in the way of me using the knife. It would be so much better if the key ring was on the other end of the knife. If you use the scissors a lot though you'll like it this way.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Prodcut is just not what it use to be... DISAPPOINTED...
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure what happened to swiss army knives... but they quality is WAY down. the plastic cover cracked from just being on my key chain... i am going to try a different brand... i am very disappointed, cause i wasted money on replacement toothpicks and tweezers thinking this item would last a few years...
customer_reviews.author: Spend-Money-Wisely

customer_reviews.title: Best Pocket Knife Ever?
customer_reviews.text: I finally lost my old Swiss Army knife, which I had for the past 10+ years. It worked great, and lasted through just about everything I have put it through. This includes burying it in the ground at concerts and other places that would confiscate it (for days at a time in some cases). It is durable and useful all the time in everyday activities. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a small, key chain knife. It doesn't have near the bells and whistles as some knives ... but it comes in handy all the time and can go through a lot of punishment.
customer_reviews.author: M. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Victorinox Swiss Army Classic SD Pocket Knife
customer_reviews.text: I work in a classroom and laboratory environment, so anything with a blade has to be politically correct or someone will flip out in a panic. This diminutive tool is totally PC, and highly functional. I mainly use it to open packages, and to trim lab tape into precise arrows for tagging anatomy models. It is so small and lightweight, I sometimes forget I'm carrying it. I have the silver alox version, which looks delicate like you could crush it under finger pressure, but trust me, it's rugged as hell.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Tiangco

customer_reviews.title: It's not a toy - it's my daily companion!
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second one of these, having lost or misplaced the first, because I use it pretty much every day. When I got my first one, it was packaged with a larger Swiss Army knife model. I thought it was a toy, but it's not. I quickly discovered how useful it is.The blade is razor-sharp and the scissors work on thick paper and even cardboard. The file is useful for a number of things, including cleaning electrical contacts. Let's not overlook the toothpick and the tweezers! And it's well-built to boot. At about $15, it's pricey, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Havemann

customer_reviews.title: Much Smaller than a Typical Swiss Army Knife
customer_reviews.text: Size matters - this is way smaller than the average Swiss Army Knife. I was embarrassed giving this as a gift. Because the knife is so small, it's hard to make out the Boy Scouts logo because it's tiny.
customer_reviews.author: Katie004

customer_reviews.title: Swiss Army Knife-don't leave home without it!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't go anywhere without my Swiss Army Knife. The small size makes it easy to carry. The scissors are amazing for cutting paper, clipping fingernails, opening packaging and lots of other things. The knife is small, but very sharp and will cut/open/peel/puncture many items. The nail file blade is handy to smooth a chipped nail, but I've used the screw driver end a lot more. The only problem.... it's so easy to carry, I've had to surrender my knife when traveling... the airport guys won't let you take then on the plane!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on a recommendation from some backpacking blog. I had a pocket knife and promptly lost it on my first ever backpacking trip.....whoops. I wanted to replace it but I also really wanted scissors for cutting bandages and moleskin so I looked into a multi tool. I love this little guy! I haven’t taken it out on a trip yet, but I tested out the different tools and they all work very well! It feels sturdy, not cheap. The knife and scissors are sharp. The tweezers, toothpick and nail file are added bonuses that I may never use.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi G

customer_reviews.title: The bad reviews are ridiculous!
customer_reviews.text: I am wondering what people expect for less than $20? It is designed for a keychain! It is going to get scuffed up over time. It is still Swiss made with the same quality as the bigger knives, in a budget size. It works as it should for the jobs you should be doing with it, opening packages, cleaning your fingernails, toothpick, removing splinters. I think some people think this is the knife that you should be able to go out and skin and elk with, or cut your way out of a steel box. This is a good product. In fact I liked it well enough to go ahead and by my family all one for their key chains.
customer_reviews.author: Chez

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Knife
customer_reviews.text: Knife is beautiful. I didn't know if I wanted yellow, however, it was the one on sale that day and it wasn't for me anyway. Knife to be used in a micro EDC kit. Received item on time in a sturdy mail carton. Have had problems with the Amazon envelopes being open and losing items this past month. Knife each in individual little boxes, fully sealed. Upon inspection; yellow color was beautiful (easy to find if lost), knife blade is very sharp, also has file, screw driver, scissors, tooth pick and tweezers. A fine Victorinox Swiss Army Classic pocket knife.
customer_reviews.author: Highbidder

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This WAS a Christmas gift. The knife is very small but pretty. My F-I-L loved it out of the box. He put it on his dresser after opening gifts and the next morning went to put it in his pocket and the 2 sterling silver plates had fallen off. They had been GLUED!!?? on! This knife with tax is $205. I am very disappointed and very embarrassed to have given him this gift. I do not recommend. Even if it wasn’t shoddy workmanship, the 2 thin silver plates on the sides do not warrant this price.
customer_reviews.author: dawn jordan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect keychain pocketknife
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item seven years ago, and it still works and looks new despite constant use and abuse. It's not made to replace a larger multitool, but it's small enough to be on the keychain without getting in the way. That makes it perfect for handling a lot of things that come your way. I'd buy it again, but it isn't anywhere close to wearing out so I won't need to. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Honda

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: I bought the yellow Gadsden flag knife. Scratches and key rub marks all over the plastic after only two weeks, almost looks like petena but it’s new. Otherwise it comes much sharper then the other “used” Swiss Army knives I’ve had in the past. The cosmetic durability does not affect the integrity or functionality of the knife. * 5 month update.. one of the plastic sides fell off in my pocket, standard superglue will not work with this plastic. I had a leatherman key knife before this and it was much better all around and lasted years before I lost it.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Cute Little Knife that Works
customer_reviews.text: Really cool little knife that makes a great small gift for employees or staff members and is also a great stocking stuffer. The purple knives are really pretty. Pink knives are cute. And you can't go wrong with classic red. The knives hold up for years. I still have one my boss gave me in 1989. The little scissors are the most vulnerable to failure. I've had to bend the little lever back in place a few times, but it still works. Keep in mind that this is pretty small. You're not going to skin a buck or scale a fish with it. It's just for small things like opening packages, envelopes, and very small food prep on the run.
customer_reviews.author: Lori D.

customer_reviews.title: classic but too small
customer_reviews.text: Extremely small did not know they came that small expensive but the scissors work well and the knife will cut do not waste your money micro miniature size
customer_reviews.author: John S. Presnick

customer_reviews.title: Got my baby back
customer_reviews.text: I believe I had mine for over 30 years. Saved the day soo many times and always stayed sharp. Amazing. It finally got confiscated by TSA (airport security) after all these years. Soo sad but I had to part with my baby. This new one is soo pretty blue. Same sharp knife and scissors. Thank you for an outstanding product. Keep up the good works! Like that awesome restaurant you go back to and it is still the same excellent quality, time and time again. It is all about consistent quality without compromise. Thank you soo much! Your the best!
customer_reviews.author: D. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Knife fell apart...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the polished silver version of this knife and carried it every day attached to my keys. After 5 months, the back scale fell off and I am left with a worthless piece of junk. Very disappointed as this was a great tool that I used often. I hoped the more expensive versions of this knife would have a decent build quality, but unfortunately, they dont.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Key Fob
customer_reviews.text: There are a thousand reviews of the Classic SD, so I won't bore you with another one. But I will say this... for under $15, you can't find a more useful multitool for the price. They also make great gifts or first knives for younger boys. I would recommend the Classic SD to friends and family. Please hit the 'Helpful' button if you liked my short review.
customer_reviews.author: Solo Nur Ali

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality On The Finish, Beautifully Done
customer_reviews.text: The finish on these is beautiful and it’s on both sides. Really gorgeous. Seemingly excellent quality. Time will tell. I am a bit skeptical if these are in fact genuine Victorinox because the box wasn’t at all victorinox it was a cheap mass produced generic box and every victroinox knife I’ve ever purchased came in a distinct drawer slide type box. ( I purchased two of these so it isn’t a fluke ) However, the quality on the knives itself is great and indistinguishable from any other Swiss victorinox knife and I have a bunch. It was worth the relatively high price and these are suitable as gifts
customer_reviews.author: Joel B.

customer_reviews.title: Victorinox Swiss Army Classic SD
customer_reviews.text: The translucent emerald is gorgeous. The most beautiful green. Wow. (I'm a little biased. Green is my favorite color.) And of course the functions are perfect for day to day necessities. Great quality. I've used this same style for at least 7 years. The tiny scissors are probably the most used, but every single one has come in handy. I always have one on my keychain. -Kate
customer_reviews.author: Cody B.

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these because the spring in the scissors of the one I've had for 10 years broke and it's next to useless without the scissors working properly. First impressions are that this SD is alot thinner and feels cheap/plastic-y. And they've removed some of the tools the other one had. Now I'm sure they did that for weight reduction since most people carry these in their pocket but I thought I would mention it in this review. I've enclosed some pictures comparing it to the older version. If you liked my review or found it helpful please click Helpful below this review. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: N. Bearden

customer_reviews.title: Tiny but mighty
customer_reviews.text: Well I straight up love this little thing. I thought it might be a little flimsy because its so small but it is sturdy as a rock and it is in perfect shape and I've got a bunch of knives and I swear this has the smoothest movement of all of them and its sharp as can be and blade and scissor both cut great. I'm kinda hooked again now and think I will be gettin some more Swiss Army Knives. I had one of those big ones with all the blades years ago and really liked it but I like this little fella better. Shipped fast and very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MrWheelchairGuy

customer_reviews.title: Handy little knife
customer_reviews.text: This is a city boy pocket sized knife. I use the main blade for boxes and mail as well as cleaning fingernails and the scissors for small cutting jobs like tags on new clothing and newspaper clippings. The tweezers aren't an everyday thing but good for splinters especially small metal shavings that are hard to see. I lose them so the price is an advantage when I have to replace one.
customer_reviews.author: Vintage Geek

customer_reviews.title: Great size and utility - endless uses
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th time I've time I've had to replace this knife in the last 6 years. The first was a victim of the TSA at an airport, the second going to a meeting that I didn't know was in a courthouse, and the third walking into a college football stadium. In other words all my fault since they got confiscated. I'm catching on though and generally remember to leave the deadly thing at home or in the car. About the knife - it comes sharp, stays sharp, easy to clean and durable. The tweezers and toothpick have always stayed put for me. Uniform quality in all of mine, the only difference being color.
customer_reviews.author: David E.

customer_reviews.title: You cannot go wrong with it , Must to have in ur pocket
customer_reviews.text: Best ever keychain made . U cannot go wrong with this product .. made with precision for EDC . Wat u need daily 1) we bite nail even though we are not suppose to :) but after biting we regret because we don’t have filer to fix it . Don’t worry if u hav this as ur key chain. 2) Opening a Amazon packet , it got kinfe don’t worry . 3 ) cutting the tags in ur amazon packet , don’t worry it got scissors 4) while working something got pierced in your hand or struck with bee sting .. don’t worry it got puckers .. must to have in ur pocket
customer_reviews.author: Dinesh A

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value
customer_reviews.text: The SD pocket knife is one of the most useful tools I carry with me on a daily basis and when I go hiking or backpacking. The knife is compact and light, extremely well made, and the blade holds a good edge so I always have one in my medical kit. In spite of its small size it's incredibly practical and the tweezers are fantastic for dealing with nasty Arizona desert cactus thorns. By the way, I gifted the pink one to my friend who said the pink one was a particularly excellent shade of pink and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: siafu

customer_reviews.title: Mighty little knife
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this product twice, now, because TSA took my first one away. (As if anyone could cause serious damage with this tiny blade!?) I re-purchased the same exact knife because I love it. It's small enough to stay in my pocket, adding very little bulk to my keychain, where it comes in handy about twice every day. It takes a fair amount of abuse and I've yet to break it. I've had other similar knives, and the paint invariably flakes off. That's why I originally went for this bare-metal look, and I'm happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Melvin

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this knife. I was so excited to find a pocket knife that was a little more feminine. It’s a cute bubble gum pink with the traditional Swiss Army knife design and emblem. It fits easily in your pocket and can also be attached to your keychain. It makes it really easy to just whip it out when you need to cut open a package. I’ve even used the knife/file as a screwdriver in a pinch! It’s obvious this is well made and will last. My only regret is not purchasing a knife with more functions.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Little but mighty!
customer_reviews.text: While it might not be practical to carry this in your EDC I find having it in one of my backpack pouches very handy. Yeah, there is not much to it.........Just a nail file which can double as a straight head screwdriver. But only for small tasks. A very tiny blade that is good at letter opening and loose thread cutting. And the scissors are very functional actually. It is also a great conversational piece. Love the emerald green version as it is very eye catching! For the price you can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: R. M. SilkeyTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Just what the Hubby needed
customer_reviews.text: My DH drives me crazy when he misplaces his pocket knife (late to work). He likes everything exactly in his pocket or work bag as he wants it. So I picked this one up so he could leave it in his desk at work and if he forgets or loses his regular pocket knife, he loves it. It is sharp enough for what he uses it for, it is a bright color so easy to find and most important it is handy and small enough to not take up a lot of space. Would definitely get again.
customer_reviews.author: Lora W

customer_reviews.title: I grew up with Victorinox, since this is the ...
customer_reviews.text: I grew up with Victorinox, since this is the knife my Dad uses. He's had plenty of their line, but most often uses these simple knives. When I was 15, he gave me one of my own, and I've been using it since, but it sadly broke these past few weeks. So considering these are tough, durable knives, and that it took almost ten years for mine to break on me (but I do have a second that my room mate is using on his keyring, that's still going strong), I think it's worth any amount of money you can throw at Victorinox.
customer_reviews.author: S. RyDerTop Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without this keychain knife
customer_reviews.text: Apparently, in Oregon, we are prepared. I have a friend in California who says that is our reputation. (You mean EVERYONE doesn't carry around a mini knife and scissors for little tasks daily??) Later, I subconsciously whipped out my favorite little keychain ever, and used it on something...we all laughed. Seriously, I cannot live without this little knife as my keychain. The small size is important, as I can always have it with me. IMO, its top indispensable attachments are: scissors, knife, tweezers - in that order.
customer_reviews.author: nehaleminthesun

customer_reviews.title: Tested it...Not a genuine Swiss Army Knife
customer_reviews.text: So, I tested the Rockwell hardness of the knife, and to my disappointment, its basically mild steel. What that means is this knife will dull very quickly and is problematic to sharpen, so if you're looking for a throwaway, 1time use knife, this is it. Don't expect much, as these aren't real Swiss Army knives. I have a real Swiss Army knife that is 30 years old and is still sharp, because they use hardened steel.
customer_reviews.author: MG8T

customer_reviews.title: It made her day
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for someone. I have purchased many different styles of swiss army knives for a variety of people over the years. This is a good one for an inexpensive gift, especially for someone who might be wary of carrying a knife. This is small enough to not be objectionable, useful enough so that you will be glad you have it, and with the variety of colors and the variety of tools, it might just be what gets someone excited about knifes and multi-tools.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Mercer

customer_reviews.title: Super Deadly Assault Weapon
customer_reviews.text: I almost always have one of these on my keychain. It is so convenient I usually forget it is there until I need it, or until a security guard is confiscating it on my way into some venue or another. I think these are pretty durable, I've never broken one. Haven't even lost one. But so many taken away. Each time I end up logging into amazon and ordering another. The small price paid for my inability to learn from my mistakes and my unwillingness to be without such a simple, sometimes indispensable, tool. 10/10 will buy another the next time I fly.
customer_reviews.author: Bhosley

customer_reviews.title: Nice and versatile
customer_reviews.text: I have used this model Victirinox for years. I think this one is slightly thinner than my last one which I thought I lost but recently found. I thought that it would be shinier and more neon in color, but it has a matte feel and looks a little translucent (which is probably noted in the description but in case it isn’t I note it here). I thought I’d need to get used to that, but it is growing on me, and actually the matte finish creates a little friction between my fingers when using it so all is well. I mainly use the scissors.
customer_reviews.author: ElaineL

customer_reviews.title: Use it every day
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many Swiss Army Knives (SAK) but this one is the most useful because its small size allows it to go anywhere without increasing your pocket load. At my workplace, a regular sized SAK would cause fellow employees discomfort, but this SAK hardly gains notice as a knife. And I rarely deploy the blade, since the scissors can be used for most cutting needs. The tweezers are quite precise and the toothpick is convenient. It's not for hiking or general fix-its in the house, but a useful everyday pocket tool. The white color is quite pleasant and further adds to the unobtrusiveness of the knife.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have one of these. Men and Women!
customer_reviews.text: I received one of these from WWP as a gift. I had it on my key chain for the last two years until about a week ago when TSA made me throw it away. Apparently you can't take them on the plane even though I had been on about 15 flights before this flight with it on my keys. "Keeping us safe". Anyway I went about two days without it on my keys before I had to buy a new one. If you have a son, get him one. If you have a daughter, get her one. If you have a wife, get her one.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little pocket knife
customer_reviews.text: I'm always surprised at how handy these little tools are. Sure they are not the biggest or strongest knife/scissor tools out there but they get the job done far more often than not. The best tool is the one you always have with you and these fit that perfectly. I abuse them pretty badly but I usually get 4-5 years with one of these before I feel the need to replace it. Love them and hope they never change the design and build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Enginerd

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat a classic.
customer_reviews.text: The Victorinox company has created many versions and combinations of Multi-tools. But when you need something sharp to keep next to your keys, This is it. I give this product four out of five stars because I think the company could have added on small measurements on the opposite side of the nail filing/ flat head screwdriver tool. They could have imprinted centimeters markings to help you make tiny measurements when you want to. Oh well, Still a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Steven Calabrese

customer_reviews.title: Not TSA approved
customer_reviews.text: Greatest pocket knife ever created! I have been carrying one for at least 20 years but I have had to replace it a few times. Only reason to replace, lost, stolen or lending it to someone. I give them as gifts to high school graduates but I do not think they appreciate the versatility of the knife. I will have one of these with me until I leave this world. Only issue, TSA thinks these knives are dangerous so I cannot bring it on the plane in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Bren

customer_reviews.title: Great pocket knife.
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these for over 20 years and use it frequently. But my wife looked at me funny when I got this one for her. Now she uses it regularly and says it's awesome. Having this little guy readily available on a key ring is handier than she ever thought.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick H Dammert

customer_reviews.title: Still great quality
customer_reviews.text: These Swiss Army’s are just as good quality as they were in my day if not better. The nail file doubles as a screw driver which has been tested and true. The tweezers are just how I remember them but worked better than I remember on cactus first time out. I nearly went for the next size up for my 5 and 7 year old but glad we started with these. It has everything they need and no more knife than my kids need at this time. We purchased ours for hiking and camping in the desert and mountains. They did come in very small packages within another order and I nearly threw them out.
customer_reviews.author: Baby J

customer_reviews.title: Swiss Army Knife cheaply made, no refund yet
customer_reviews.text: The knife is tiny, cheaply made, and dangerous to open (bringing a blade out of a small plastic casing almost led to getting stuck by it). Returned this item, USPS confirmed it was delivered on 5/23 back to Amazon (9500 1108 2932 0128 2841 91), and yet no refund. Cannot reach Amazon Customer Service by phone or email. Pretty frustrating, especially given the amount of orders I’ve placed recently.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney

customer_reviews.title: Victorinox Swiss Army Knives (Silver Alox)
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the Victorinox Swiss Army Knives (Silver Alox). I am a person who reads a lot before buying anything. This product is amazing. The difference between the "Silver Alox" and other Swiss knives that the other ones have plastic covers on them in which breaks by time.The Silver Alox is much smaller and lighter on the key chain. I use this everyday. The blade is so sharp (be careful with kids playing with it). The Silver Alox is 100% metal and can last forever. I bough 9 of it as gifts and I will buy more! Highly recommended! I am Not Rich To Buy Cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Not Rich To Buy Cheap

customer_reviews.title: Just a great thing to have in your pocket
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these in my pocket every day. Let me tell why you should too: Need to cut something: it's a knife, so yeah Need to file your nails: yep, gotcha, nail file Got some stuff in your teath: yep, toothpick Need a very small scissors: got it Got a splinter or a stray eyebrow lash: yep, tweezers Snark aside, I really have found it useful for all the reasons I mentioned and more. I don't even notice it my pocket until something comes up for a use, and then I have it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great knife!
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of this style Victorinox knives that I keep in my glove box, backpack, tool box, desk drawer and other places. In the past I have had this in other colors. This is the first in the StayGlow color. I didn't realize it but it glows in the dark, which is great for finding it in dark places. The surface finish on the handle has a slight texture to it rather than the smooth finish of the other colors that I've purchased previously.
customer_reviews.author: J. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Tiny little pretty colored swiss army for a kid
customer_reviews.text: This knife is good for a kid, nice little swiss army for my daughter, she wanted a purple pocket knife. It is functional and fairly well built, but clearly not a top shelf piece of equipment. It's very small. A grown man would struggle to just hold this tiny thing. But for a small child this is the right size. Blade, scissors, file, pick, tweezers are included. Everything works well. Fits in a kid's pocket. My daughter loves this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I love these on my Key chain. I’m on my third one. It can handle most jobs and saves me from dulling the blade on my good knife. Careful not to lose the toothpick and tweezers. The knife and scissors are the most useful parts. The file, toothpick and tweezers a little less so. The file does have a sometimes useful little flathead screwdriver on the tip, I’ve used it in a pinch for small screws including som small Phillips.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have had many of these pocket knives over the years and this is the first one that I have had that I have lost the tooth pick. One day when I went to use it was gone it must have slipped out of its slot. I use that toothpick frequently so to not have it is frustrating. For the high price I pay for these pocketknives it should not have been able to slip out of its slot so easily by itself. Better yet include a few extras in the package just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More like a child's toy
customer_reviews.text: This was more like a toy, very flimsy got no use out of it
customer_reviews.author: Dayzaway

customer_reviews.title: Classic Red, too
customer_reviews.text: Old Faithful. Great, versatile little knife for lots of light duty stuff. The scissors come in handy to snip off loose threads on a blazer or the tweezers to remove a splinter. The blade is sharp as heck and will take a re-edge well. I have larger Victorinox Swiss Army knives for around the house and general duty, but these little Classic SD knives are great for a night out with the wife. 5 stars all the way.
customer_reviews.author: rsa

customer_reviews.title: My Grandson's love theirs
customer_reviews.text: I bought each of my grandson's one of these and they love them. I have owned these for years (I have several) and thought it was time I gave my grandson's their first (they are 8 & 11). All the features come in handy, the tooth pick, tweezers, scissors, finger nail file and of course the sharp knife blade. They just last and last. Beware taking them with you if you fly though... I have had several confiscated because I forgot I had them in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Nice, cute, practical...and it's Jewish!
customer_reviews.text: With its knife, file, scissors, tweezers and toothpick, this little bit of Swiss brilliance belongs on your keychain. You will be amazed as to how often it will come in handy. And it's from the Jewish side of the Victorinox family, so it is blue instead of red and sports a star of David instead of a cross. It's a great item to have and to give as a gift; I just had to get one for my brother and sister as well as for myself. Just be sure not to carry it on a plane as it will most likely get confiscated!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca K.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size!
customer_reviews.text: I was so annoyed when walking to my local supermarket at 7AM each day to get a newspaper, only to find the papers stacked on the floor and wrapped tightly in twine - and no staff close at hand to assist. So, I went on Amazon to search for the smallest knife I could find that would fit nicely in my pocket. This Swiss Army Classic is perfect and I can now get my daily newspaper and be on my way.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Glowing Victorinox excellence.
customer_reviews.text: Again nothing short of impressed by Victorinox. Usually carry 2-3 layer SAKS for urban edc such as the cadet, pioneer, and tinker. Wanted to get a classic as it is a keychain option and is truly the "classic." The stayglow scales glow very bright and it is quite incredible . I was shocked at how small the blade is but it is still sharp and slicey like any other platform. The file is great as always and the scissors are better then the ones on my Evo. Can't go wrong for $20!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A favorite
customer_reviews.text: This knife is my very favorite go everywhere key chain attached pocket knife. Super high quality, super handy, do it all fantastic little piece. I had one previously and it fell lost off the key chain.... and I immediately had to buy another.....
customer_reviews.author: ohioriver

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for your favorite Eagle Scout!
customer_reviews.text: My son was invited to an Eagle Scout ceremony for a friend of his. We wanted to give him a meaningful gift, and a quick search for "Eagle Scout gifts" turned up this knife. Every young man should have a pocket knife, and with the Eagle emblem on it this was perfect. We ended up getting it directly from the Victorinox website because we could get the boy's name inscribed on it, but I wanted to tell Amazon buyers that this is a nice quality gift. It's a small knife, with just the blade, file, toothpick and tweezers, and scissors on it - but a great size for daily carrying.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Kearns

customer_reviews.title: So, I purchased this little beauty to replace one ...
customer_reviews.text: So, I purchased this little beauty to replace one very similar to it that I'd gotten for a lady I was dating. Well, a little 3d printing magic, some homemade nachose, and now that lady is my fiance. Not saying this knife will catch you a woman, but it sure has a place in my heart.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Knisely

customer_reviews.title: One problem
customer_reviews.text: This knife is exactly what I needed. I like to keep a small knife on my key ring. This one has everything, knife, nail file, scissors, tweezers, etc. But the ring is at the wrong end of it. So, when it's on your key ring, and you open it up to use it, the middle is attached to your keys. Really hard to use it that way.
customer_reviews.author: Daffodilmom

customer_reviews.title: Girls best friend!
customer_reviews.text: My all time favorite pocket knife, i carry it in my make-up bag. Just remember to take it out of any carry on luggage or TSA will confiscate it and thats a sad goodbye. The durability of this brand is outstanding. For the price its also a great gift to give your friends.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Wilkens

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT small pocket knife
customer_reviews.text: I had a little pocket knife like this years ago and lost it. I finally got around to replacing it. It is a GREAT little knife. Takes up little room so I can have it in my pocket at all times. Love the scissors....there are times when that is exactly what you need. Well constructed and looks just like the picture. I see where you can order new 'toothpicks' for these now too! I will keep these knives in mind when i hunt for next years stocking stuffer gifts!!!! You could keep 1 in a bedside table drawer, in the car, in the junk drawer...inexpensive and very useful!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Frace

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like
customer_reviews.text: I've had this model knife for 10 years or so and lost it (actually I had to give it up at an air show). I had to replace it and I did. Knife is just too good as a keychain knife to lose. For me the scissors are the real reason I have it. Sometimes you just need a small pair of scissors for a small precise cut and these work fine for that. I don't leave home without it.
customer_reviews.author: MLO

customer_reviews.title: A pocket knife that is small enough to actually carry
customer_reviews.text: The best pocket knife is the one you have in your pocket. I've had bigger and "better" knives, but always got tired of putting up with them in my pocket. This one almost doesn't register...but it's always there when I need it. It's pretty sturdy for what it is. The blade doesn't hold an edge as long as I'd like, but I've found nothing better in the same form factor.
customer_reviews.author: MrMark

customer_reviews.title: Recommended. Great price, size, and versatility
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing at least once a day. The knife, file, screwdriver, scissors, tweezers, and pick all come in handy for all kinds of occasions. My favorite part is that it is phosphorescent! I never leave the house without my Victorinox because it's always attached to my key ring. I like it so much, in fact, I gifted a few to my friends. Highly recommend this little guy -- you never know when you're going to need it. Its small size makes it easy to carry anywhere, while its myriad tools offer a lot in the way of versatility.
customer_reviews.author: Someguy

customer_reviews.title: This one is exactly what I wanted in a great color to boot
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small pocket knife or utility tool that I could have on hand for opening packages or other things on the fly. This one is exactly what I wanted in a great color to boot. The tool features a blade, scissors, file, tweezers, toothpick, and screwdriver. The keychain attachment makes it easy to hook onto my keys and the small size means it doesn't add much weight. The scissors are small but usable if you use the body of the knife as part of the scissor grip. Everything has been working great and I'm glad to have it.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Print

customer_reviews.title: It's a great little knife
customer_reviews.text: I've been shopping around for a new pocket knife but been looking for one not made in China. I mostly needed the knife part for opening packages, but I've actually been using the scissors much more than I thought I would. It's sturdy and well made. I plan on buying another eventually so I have a spare. The only tool missing I'd really like to have on this too is a Phillips.
customer_reviews.author: Reign

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant engineered simplicity
customer_reviews.text: I have carried one of these for 10 years now. Easy to carry in a pocket because of its size. Many times I have used the knife blade for a loose thread, to open packages, etc. And the scissors really make it a no brainer for me. Who would have thought you could safely carry a pair of scissors (small as it is) in your pocket. For simple common jobs, this is a treasure.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Sam

customer_reviews.title: Prefect size
customer_reviews.text: Replacement my husband forgets to take the knife out of his pocket when we go to a baseball or getting on a airplane so we have to buy one of these every year or so. He loves the Swiss Army knife ,opening that package that will not come open even if you beat it with a sledgehammer clean your nails, cut the coupon out perfect little knife to have in your pocket!
customer_reviews.author: C.R. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great price & craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: Swiss Army knife. Brother in law said he needed a knife to carry in his pocket. The price was right and I know Swiss’s value & craftsmanship is unbeatable. You have tweezers, scissors, and two knives. Nothing extravagant just the right tools for the job. Small enough to fit in your hand but sharp enough to do any job. I actually ended up buying one for myself and putting on my key ring.
customer_reviews.author: J Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little tool
customer_reviews.text: Victorinox SD is such a nifty little tool. I carry it on my keys and barely notice it’s there and it always comes in handy when I need it. It’s so light weight but sturdy. I love the sharp tiny scissors and tweezers. The blade is sharp and snaps back into place with ease. The nail file is super handy for in the go nail repairs. Still haven’t used it for its sd feature but I’m sure it’s great too.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: No Reason Not to Have This on You
customer_reviews.text: Small, light and super useful! For everyday things like using the scissors to cut off a clothing tag that is bothering the back of your neck, it is very useful to have the scissors. The profile of the scissors are very flat, so I've used it many times to cut off those painful peeling skin around the fingernail. The knife is sometimes useful for opening a package. The tweezers fell out within a week of having this tool... But for what it is, I still love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ninjanoises

customer_reviews.title: Every Keychain Needs One!!
customer_reviews.text: I like these classic saks because they're small enough to comfortably fit onto a key chain without being too bulky or heavy. The knife comes in handy for opening those stubborn packages, or the mail. Chip a nail? The file works great!! Being a maintenance man and well at home use i use the flat head screwdriver part a lot!! Plenty of splinters pulled out with the tweezers and a lot of jerky picked from my teeth!! As the headline says every key chain needs one!! Great for all ages between 8 and 80. Great gifts :)
customer_reviews.author: Dan Griden

customer_reviews.title: Essential Dad Tool
customer_reviews.text: Small and incredibly convenient to carry everywhere. I carry this on my car key ring so I always have access to it. As a dad to three kids, I can not begin to count the number of times I have used this, from cutting up a hotdog, to snipping a loose thread and pulling a sliver out of a weeping child. Simple handy tools that are easy to use. Caution: security at events do not like these and I have lost two to security check points at concerts and stadiums (but if you put it in your shoe they usually miss it. Just don't leave it on your car keys where they will see it)
customer_reviews.author: J. Sitzman

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pocket knife
customer_reviews.text: The only thing this is missing is a nail clipper haha. I would gladly exchange the scissor function of this thing for a nail clipper even though i know it probably wouldnt be able to fit. The knife on this thing is pretty sharp so be careful when using it. It looks dull in the photo but when you use it to cut open boxes, the tape just get sliced right off. It is light and the polish is finished quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Victorinox Swiss Army Classic SD Pocket Knife is a great and invaluable utility tool
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th purchase of Victorinox Swiss Army Classic SD Pocket Knife. Not because they broke - but I keep forgetting to take it off my keyring when going to concerts and or public events. They usually end up taking it from me. I must replace it as it is invaluable to me for everyday use. I most often use it to open a package or clip a nail.
customer_reviews.author: Rooftopp

customer_reviews.title: Toothpick
customer_reviews.text: if you're like me you like grilled meat wherever you order it. sometimes that gets stuck in my teeth and I love not having to track down a toothpick because this has one. The small pocket knife is good for opening amazon packages and the scissors are good for the occasional straying beard hair. It was worth the money which wasn't a lot for how much I use it
customer_reviews.author: Badazz McCool

customer_reviews.title: Very useful high-quality pocket knife!
customer_reviews.text: I've been carrying one of these knives around forever and I use it for something almost every day - every couple of years I lose it and get a new one in a different color :-) You get a knife blade, screwdriver/nail file/pry bar, scissors, tooth pick, and tweezers in a nice small package. I've mistreated these knives terribly and they've never broken or failed to accomplish what I was trying to do. Buy with confidence!
customer_reviews.author: Honest John

customer_reviews.title: Great essential tool for pocket/purse carry
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get the missus something to keep with her for utility purposes at all times. I like the SOG key knife, but since she carries a purse, she didn't have the same size restrictions. I've always liked Victorinox Swiss Army knives since I was introduced to them as a kid (a friend in Boy Scouts). The classic red and build quality made me feel good about choosing this one. She keeps this on a keyring with the house keys and it goes with her everywhere. It's already proved its usefulness by opening some packages and cutting fasteners off of new gifts. Unlike the larger multitools, it's sleek and easy to carry with you all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Kaizoku!

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great gift!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this knife. My first one was sadly confiscated by airport security (oops) but I loved it so much I purchased a replacement right away. It is small enough for your keychain and super useful for opening boxes, nipping loose threads on clothing, and using as a screwdriver. I use mine all the time and I think it would make a very useful gift.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: These things are rock solid.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a handful of these small knives over the years, and they've always been rock solid. They're a very practical gift, and are a go-to whenever I need to trim my nails or need a toothpick in a hurry. The scissors and knife are well-built and stay sharp, and the tweezers are superb... much less slippery and grip better than larger ones. There's always a good use case for this small utility knife.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best little tool! Lost mine, bought another one - the cobalt blue model. Every man should have one. Swiss made, stainless steel, small and compact. One jack knife blade, one combo screwdriver/file blade, scissors, tweezers and tooth pick. Handy as heck and in such a small package it fits in any mans pocket with his handkerchief or the other pocket with keys and change. Even though it's stainless steel, it holds a decent edge and will only rarely need to be sharpened. Each tool works well exactly as it's supposed to. There are lots of Chinese-made knockoffs, but they pale in comparison to this, the real thing. This is a great little tool, definitely five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Stone Dog

customer_reviews.title: Great Everyday Carry Knife
customer_reviews.text: The Swiss Army Classic SD is known for being a small and sharp little knife, and this one didn't disappoint. Very sharp, and in a very convenient size to carry everyday. Build quality is excellent as it always is from Swiss Army, and I'll be carrying this one until I inevitably break it or lose it, at which point I'll simply get another.
customer_reviews.author: Aleks K.

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking. Very compact, but not durable.
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and feel of this knife. The compactness is worth not having the toothpick and tweezers. However, that’s where the good stops. The screwdriver on the tip of the file is too thin to actually fill the slots of most screws. This has led to it warping under even light use. That brings me to the second point: the steel’s durability. After light use over several months, I already have a few nicks in the blade. That’s bad enough, but the blade has also dulled very quickly. I originally purchased this to have something more pocketable than my mini Leatherman, but it’s clearly not built to the same standards.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Arakelian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect on your keychain that holds house keys and car keys
customer_reviews.text: Compact, attractive, useful. My keychain consists of a small central caribiner to which are attached car keys and house keys. This lightweight swiss army knife is easily detached from the caribiner when needed. Looks good, feels good, works good (sorry, grammarians). Gives me a small squirt of dopaminergic joy every time I look at it.
customer_reviews.author: GirlScoutDad

customer_reviews.title: once you carry one, you won't know how you got along without it...
customer_reviews.text: I lose a couple of these a year at the airport, unfortunately, and just keep buying them. Perfect little set of tools to always have in your pocket, but small enough that you don't know it's there. You don't realize how many uses you, or the people around you have for scissors, or a small knife, until you carry one of these. Wounded Warrior is a worthy cause, so I keep buying the wounded warrior version. Just check, and double check your pockets, BEFORE you end up in the security line at the airport :) p.s. If you have a beard, the scissors are invaluable for clipping strays...
customer_reviews.author: Wingnut

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I've always had one of these on my keychain and I find uses for it all the time (often to open my packages from amazon!). These are well made little knives with just the essentials and no bulky attachments I will never use. Also I like that I can order replacement toothpicks and tweezers if the originals ever get lost. I purchased the green one this time and it looks quite sharp. I'm sure it will last until I forget to take it off my key ring when I go through airport security (again).
customer_reviews.author: Charles C.

customer_reviews.title: These Little Things Are The Best
customer_reviews.text: Everyone knows what a Swiss Army Knife is - no point in elaborating there. These are the gold standard for the price/quality ratio. Handy little tools. Never once have I been worried about durability or breaking the tool. Especially the screwdriver. Even after admittedly putting way more stress on the screwdriver than I should have been while trying to pull out a stripped screw, the tool held up just fine. Only regret is I didn't buy another to keep in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Simple, but functional knife.
customer_reviews.text: Very simple, but handy. I have several of this knife (in bright orange). I keep one in my backpack, and I add one to each of my various first aid kits for car, camping, etc. Cut things, minor finger/toenail maintenance, etc. It's not a primary knife, but a good backup, for opening packaging, etc. The tweezers are nice and sharp. Also, I find that this is often missed by tsa, but it's inexpensive enough that I won't be heartbroken if it gets confiscated.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: The preferred pocket knife of thieving security a$$ho1es across airports of the world!
customer_reviews.text: This was the best penknife I owned. I say 'owned' because the a$$ho1es at Las Vegas airport took it off me because, clearly, I would use a 1" blade and a pair of 1/3" scissors to commandeer an airliner. No doubt they are now sitting on their fat butts marvelling at the build quality, the way the blades stay sharp after months of use, and the handy attachments included in the handle. Even now they are probably hoping that more people attempt to take them on to their precious aircraft so they can take them away and give them to friends and relatives as Christmas gifts. Not bitter, honest :-/ Seriously, its a great knife.
customer_reviews.author: Finch

customer_reviews.title: Silver Alox
customer_reviews.text: My 5 star rating is only for the Silver Alox model. Most of the other models have plastic bolsters (sides). As a pocket knife, it is constantly rubbing against keys and other things in your pocket, which quickly scratches up the plastic bolsters. The Silver Alox model does not seem to be damaged by other items in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: It's Victorinox, it's high quality
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have had this particular knife for years. But sometimes we lose ou knife or it gets confiscated at the courthouse even thought the blade length is WAY under the maximum limits. Screeners can be SO stupid by not knowing their own regulations. My wife and I both like to have this knife in different colors to match our purse/attire.
customer_reviews.author: BradleyK

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Little Tool
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a cheap little one I got at a trinket store when I was a kid, because having the tiny knife and scissors on hand were so convenient. This one is by FAR nicer than the one I had before. Much sharper, slimmer, and easier to use - and as a bonus, the purple color is EXACTLY as shown in the photo, which is pretty rare in my online shopping experience. It matches my lanyard and my flash drive exactly, so it's the newest permanent addition to my keys.
customer_reviews.author: Aud

customer_reviews.title: Best tool in the world
customer_reviews.text: The epitome of EDC. I don't go anywhere without this thing (except for airplanes since they frown on that). But you better believe it's in my checked luggage wherever i go. The knife is great for simple cutting tasks and the scissors are fantastic for lightweight use (also works as a nail clippers in a pinch. Tweezers are incredibly versatile and the toothpick should win an award for getting dust out of the charge port on my iPhone. I find myself reaching for this more often than my leatherman. best part, when I inevitably loose it after a few months of use, they are inexpensive. Keep making them, and I'll keep buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an Office Drone
customer_reviews.text: I am an Office Drone and find this tiny knife to be very handy. The knife practically disappears in your pocket. Nobody bats an eye if I use in the office. Toolset is handy enough. All tools work as you would expect. Knife blade has limited utility due to it's small size but that was self evident when purchased. Carry every day to work. Typically carry a larger knife on weekends. So impressed I bought one for each of the kids too.
customer_reviews.author: Cask

customer_reviews.title: Essential pocket tool
customer_reviews.text: I try to carry this knife where ever I go, as it seems the right tool for any number of situations - even in this minimalist configuration. I've never had either the knife of scissors get dull, since I occasionally forget it's in my pocket when flying or going into government offices - resulting in the need for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Jimi Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: I only received a partial order
customer_reviews.text: the only problem is that I only receive for knives and I ordered six. When I called I found out all I could do was to order six more but I only need two so I canceled the order, even though I would have gotten for free. I would still like them to send me two knives that were either remove from the box or accidentally dropped out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight for keychain.
customer_reviews.text: Smallest of the Swiss Army knives. This Model doesn’t have those flimsy plastic toothpick or tweezers that always get lost. It has a standard blade a nail file / screwdriver tip & those little scissors. That’s it. Light weight makes it perfect for keychain. Remember to leave it at home when you travel though as it’s likely to be confiscated at airports or cruise terminals.
customer_reviews.author: D. Morgenstern

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars for the Original Multi-Function Tool
customer_reviews.text: Review of: "Swiss Army Classic SD Pocket Knife," by Victorinox. Excellent pocket knife! This great little tool is so small, yet so functional. The unit comes with a sharpened knife blade, a file with blunt regular screwdriver edge, functional scissors, a pair of tweezers, and a toothpick. The knife is attached to a small split key-ring which can serve to attach itself to any regular keyring the owner has so that it will always be available for immediate use. What else needs to be said. This is a great knife! Five stars for the original multi-function tool.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hauck (Guerrilla Reader)Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, Useful, Lasts For-stinking-ever.
customer_reviews.text: Had an old green one, which my dad gave me. He used it a lot and a while after I got it the sides fell off. Sans sides (and subsequently sans toothpick and tweezers which I never sued anyway) the thing lasted for years more. Finally a spring inside corroded enough to snap so I had to buy a new. $10 for pocked scissors that will last for 20 years? Yep, fine by me!
customer_reviews.author: YourCallCannotBeConnected

product_meta.title: Victorinox Swiss Army Classic SD Pocket Knife
product_meta.description: The 2 1/4" Classic SD is the epitome of Swiss Army Knife. 7 functions to help you get through the day. Tools include: scissors, key ring, tweezers, toothpick, blade, nail file with screwdriver. Key ring attached. Stainless steel implements.
feature_bullets: A CUT ABOVE THE REST: Compact, agile and ready to face any adventure head-on. Our range of Swiss Army Knives have been established since 1897 and continue to be an icon of utility and smart design.
DURABLE CONSTRUCTION: Swiss made stainless steel construction encased in our popular scales offers a slimmer profile and is extremely resistant.

FIT FOR ALL TASKS: At their heart, all our pocket knives are a survival tool; multitaskers that deliver in any situation. At their most evolved they have surpassed basic function to pioneer space travel and restart engines.

TRUSTED QUALITY: Made in Switzerland; Victorinox provides a lifetime guarantee against defects in material and workmanship. Making a lifetime commitment has never been so easy. No assembly required, money back guarantee.
PRODUCT DETAILS: Swiss made pocket knife with 7 functions. Height: 0.4 in, Length: 2.3 in., Weight: 0.7 oz., MM: 58mm, Scale Material: ABS/Cellidor
FUNCTIONS: small blade, scissors, nail file, screwdriver 2.5 mm, key ring, toothpick, tweezers
COMPACT CARRY: Bring this knife with you on your daily adventures without sacrificing space. It makes a great gift for any occasion or stocking stuffer for Christmas.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
